meanings.definition: A tray or box in which incoming mail is placed.
meanings.sent1: I put the letter in the inbox.
meanings.sent2: My inbox is full of letters.
meanings.sent3: The inbox was so full, it looked like a treasure chest of mail.
meanings.sent4: Her inbox overflowed with letters, like a waterfall of paper.
meanings.sent5: The inbox on my desk is like a hungry monster, always wanting more mail.

meanings.definition: A folder in an email program where new messages are received and stored.
meanings.sent1: I checked my inbox for new emails.
meanings.sent2: Her inbox had many unread messages.
meanings.sent3: The inbox beeped happily as new emails arrived.
meanings.sent4: His inbox was a digital library of messages, neatly organized.
meanings.sent5: The inbox on my computer screen blinked with new messages, like a digital heartbeat.
